attributes.action: KEEP CERVICAL SCREENING TESTS EVERY 3 YEARS
attributes.additional_details:
5 years is too long when anything could happen. People can test negative for HPV and 3 years later test positive. Waiting 5 years too long and could be dangerous for women. 

You can have cervical cancer without testing positive for HPV. Low risk does not mean NO risk! 

Women’s health isn’t a toy. It shouldn’t be played with. Keep it at 3 years.
attributes.background: We need women’s cervical screening tests to stay at EVERY 3 years and the age to be lowered.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/729981
